chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Restitution - Joint/Several:
$4,689.97 to Edgar A Gongora
$3,209.53 to Anthony Ortego
$197.38 Crime Victim Compensation Program

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay Restitution of $12,410.52, joint and several with co-defendants.
Make monthly payments toward restitution amount.

If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Pay costs within 90 days of discharge.  3 months prior to the end of extended supervision, costs are to be paid.
No Contact, direct or indirect intentionally, unless permitted by agent in advance, while on extended supervision with Edgar Gongora, Anthony Ortega, Rogelio Miranda Hildago.
No Contact with Megan Dennison and Melissa Dennison.
No Contact with Samantha Smith, Amanda Johnson or Triston Carter.
Comply with other assessments, treatments or programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC and agent while on supervision.
Sign appropriate releases of information for assessments for Dept and the agent to obtain medical records regarding medications.
Do not possess or consume any controlled substances unless have a valid prescription, then use only as prescribed by physician.
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time.
Provide DNA sample if not done so.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher L Green in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Christopher L Green in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:48 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for sentencing this morning.
Parties are ready to proceed.

There is no reason why the Court should not proceed to sentencing this morning.

Court has read the PSI earlier and was provided an addendum this morning.
Parties have also received a copy of the addendum.

State has complied with the victim notification statutes.
There are no written statements.

State has restitution summaries, copies have been provided to Atty Bliss and the Court.

Atty Bliss addresses the Court, is not aware of any significant errors in the PSI but intends to make comments.
Atty Cousins has no corrections to offer to the Court regarding the PSI.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court prior to sentencing. There is credit.
Atty Bliss addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court has reviewed the file and PSI and has heard and considered the arguments of the parties. The Court appreciates the addendum of the PSI. Court believes the joint recommendation is appropriate.

Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 6 Years
Initial Confinement of 3 Years
Extended Supervision of 3 Years
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release
306 Days of Credit. Court will give the State 10 days to check to see if this is correct.
Conditions:
Pay Restitution of $12,410.52, joint and several with co-defendants
Make monthly payments toward restitution amount
Pay costs within 90 days of discharge.  3 months prior to the end of extended supervision, costs are to be paid
No Contact, direct or indirect intentionally, unless permitted by agent in advance, while on extended supervision with Edgar Gongora, Anthony Ortega, Rogelio Miranda Hildago
No Contact with Megan Dennison and Melissa Dennison
No Contact with Samantha Smith, Amanda Johnson or Triston Carter
Comply with other assessments, treatments or programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC and agent while on supervision
Sign appropriate releases of information for assessments for Dept and the agent to obtain medical records regarding medications
Do not possess or consume any controlled substances unless have a valid prescription, then use only as prescribed by physician
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Provide DNA sample if not done so

Count 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3.5 Years
Initial Confinement of 1.5 Years
Extended Supervision of 2 Years
Concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs

Court addresses Defendant regarding possession of firearm and body armour, civil rights regarding voting and rights to appeal if choose to.
Defendant is remanded to custody of WI State Prison for Defendant to start sentence.

9:43 AM Hearing is concluded.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:31 p.m. Defendant Christopher L Green in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Christopher L Green in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Cousins requests 5 min break to review offer.  BTC: in recess 5 mins.
1:37 p.m. Court back in session.
ADA Cousin states there will be an Amended Information that will be filed later with the Clerk.  It amends Count 1 to 943.32(1)(a) Felony E.  
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Plea to amended Count 1 and Count 4.  Prison sentence Count 1 at 3 yrs In & 3 yrs ES and Count 4 at 1.5 yrs In & 2 yrs ES, concurrent with Count 1.  PSI report is requested.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Cts 1 and Cts 4  - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of amended Count 1 and Count 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Dismissed and Read In are counts 2, 3, 5, 6, & 7.

BY THE COURT:***PSI REPORT ORDERED***have PSI filed by 01-04-16  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Green in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Christopher L Green in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case is set for a Motion for Bond Modification and Motion in Limine.

3:30 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearnces.
Atty Cousins makes statements that the defense has filed 2 motions.
Court will do the Motion in Limine first.
Court states that the Motion in Limine is in regard to the DNA provided.
Atty Cousins makes statements as to where the DNA was retrieved.
Court questions the defense counsel; defense counsel makes statements regarding the DNA evidence and is requesting this be suppressed.
Court questions Atty Cousins regarding the DNA results and he responds and the results had been provided to the Defense Attorney on August 3, 2015 the same date as the prosecutor received.
Atty Cousins makes additional statements and requests the motion be denied.
Atty Bliss makes statements regarding the prejudice that he had not received the DNA evidence within the required 45 days.
Atty Bliss indicates that if the DNA evidence will be allowed he will then withdraw his speedy trial and do his own analysis.
Court makes statements.
Atty Bliss is requesting 30-45 day.
Atty Cousins states that he and the defense attorney can meet with the Br. 2 JA and set a date.
Parties have moved to the bond modification.
Atty Cousins makes statements that the Bond is currently a $50,000.00 cash bond and makes additional statements.
Atty Bliss makes statements and requests that his client's bond be amended to a signature bond.
Atty Cousins make statements that the defendant does have prior convictions in Iowa and is a resident of Iowa so that is why the cash bond had been requested.

BY THE COURT: 
Motion in Limine is denied.
Bond modification is denied.
Defendant's Motion for Discovery and Inspection
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine
Request for Warrant for Communications, Affidavit in Support, Warrant for Content, Return of Officer, Orders & Findings
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Court calls 9:13 a.m. Defendant Christopher L Green in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Christopher L Green in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  State files Information. (filed after court - same charges)
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

3:39 p.m. Defendant Christopher L Green in court with attorney John M. Bliss. Defendant Christopher L Green in custody. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Cousins calls witness, Det. John Lawrynk, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam. 
3:50 p.m. Cross exam by Atty Bliss.
3:57 p.m.   BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
  Arraignment scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Melissa Dennison, Megan Dennison, Edgar Gongora, Anthony Ortega, Rogelio Miranda Hidalgo, Samantha Smith, Amanda Johnson.  That includes no contact even if he is incarcerated.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

Defendant Christopher L Green appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
 Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.

Court will adjourn for time to have counsel appointed. 
Atty Cousins requests an adjourned appearance for 4/13. 

State recommends a substantial cash bond with conditions as stated.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is quashed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
